attributes.comment:
It's recommended CMS enhance interoperability between HHS,CMS and the Beneficiary and Family

Centered Care Quality Improvement Organizations(BFCC-QIO). Enhanced interoperability includes

auditing complaints with significant emphasis on provider patterns and practices that

negatively affect a beneficiary's betterment,well-being or otherwise it degrades a

beneficiary's experience considering an individual's medical,psychiatric and psychological

history which may lead to a fraud,waste and abuse investigation.

It's further recommended CMS use it's National Directory of Health Care Providers and Services

to establish a higher than BFCC-QIO level appeals process that includes an ALJ document review

to determine if substantial evidence supports the BFCC-QIO conclusions about all relevant

matters. If substantial evidence is not present,the BFCC-QIO must issue a corrective decision

with the most deference toward CMS programs and beneficiary protection based on the record

evidence before them.

--
This submission may or may not contain error and or flaw.

Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 and or The Americans with Disabilities Act

shall apply.
